title: Animating Quines for Larva Labs
partialText: A collaboration with my friends, Matt Hall and John Watkinson, on their generative art project that blurs the line between its code and the art it produces.

title: Going independent again
partialText: I’m returning to independent life after a long stint cosplaying an employee in the full-time world.

title: Cleaning up the cobwebs
partialText: After years of side-eyeing an unreleased feature that has been nagging me while slowing down the app, I finally take the time to remove it from the app.

title: Building a table for the nth time - Part 2
partialText: Following up on the initial post about building a table in Cushion, I actually detail my approach this time.

title: How to use Playwright with GitHub Actions for e2e testing of Vercel preview deployments
partialText: I spent way too long trying to find out how to set up e2e testing with Vercel preview deploys, so I wrote a quick post to save others.

title: Building a table for the nth time
partialText: Now that I have data to wire up, I set out to build a table component, but first I revisit past attempts.

title: A return to tabbed navigation
partialText: With a focus on navigation, I return to the early days when Cushion had a simple tabbed nav.

title: End-to-end testing with Playwright
partialText: With the stack picked out, I set up end-to-end testing from the start, so I can get in the habit of testing user flows without any excuses.

title: Vercel, Supabase, Vue, and Vite
partialText: As I rethink Cushion in the modern age, I detail my choices for platform, stack, and database.

title: Imagining Cushion circa 2016 in 2024
partialText: With Cushion’s 10-year anniversary approaching, a theory leads to an attempt at a modern upgrade, but with 2016’s feature set.
